articles.title: SpaceX Plans To Send NASA Astronauts To Space in Q2 This Year - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: After NASA and SpaceX successfully completed a launch escape demonstration of the company's Crew Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket.

articles.title: NASA Explore Technology To Build Future Homes Made of Fungi For Moon, Mars - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: Instead of habitats made of metal and glass, NASA is exploring technologies that could grow structures out of fungi to become our future homes in the stars.

articles.title: First woman in space says Russians will be first on Mars - TASS
articles.description: The first female cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova told a forum she would have been ready to go to the Red Planet herself, if it was not for her age
articles.content: YAROSLAVL, November 21. /TASS/. The first female cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova said on Monday she believed Russians would be the first to land on Mars and she would have been ready to go to the Red Planet herself, if it was not for her age.Tereshkova made th… [+724 chars]

articles.title: Curiosity Rover of NASA Snaps its Last Selfie on Martian Ridge - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: After spending more than a year on a twisting ridge on Mars, NASA's Curiosity rover has snapped its last selfie as it moves on to new sights on the Red Planet

articles.title: Moon May Have Harboured Life 4 Billion Years Ago, Research Suggests - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: While the Moon is presently unsuitable for habitation, there could have been life on its surface about four billion years ago, researchers have suggested.

articles.title: NASA Funding Project RAMA To Turn Asteroids Into Spaceships - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: NASA has recently announced it would give funds to a California-based 3D printing company for finding ways to turn asteroids into giant, autonomous spacecraft, which could fly to outposts in space, the media reported.

articles.title: NASA releases its latest Global maps of Earth at Night, provides clearest patterns of Human Settlement across the Planet - http://www.newsgram.com/
articles.description: NASA has released its latest global maps of Earth at night, providing the "clearest yet composite" view of patterns of human settlement across our planet.
